contentrichtext.text: '''Berwyn''' originally referred to the [[Berwyn range]] of mountains in northeast Wales: *[[Cadair Berwyn]] or Cader Berwyn is a mountain summit in north east Wales *[[Cadair Berwyn North Top]] or Cadair Berwyn (Old Top) is a top of Cadair Berwyn in north east Wales *[[Berwyn Mountain UFO incident]], the second most well known British "UFO crash" '''It is also the name of some places in the United States of America and Canada:''' *[[Berwyn, Alberta]], a village in northern Alberta, west of Peace River *[[Berwyn, Illinois]], a city in Cook County, Illinois *[[Berwyn, Nebraska]], a village in Custer County, Nebraska *[[Berwyn, Pennsylvania]], census-designated place in Chester County, Pennsylvania *[[Berwyn Heights, Maryland]], a town in Prince George's County, Maryland *[[Berwyn Township (disambiguation)]], multiple places '''It can be a person's name:''' *[[Berwyn Jones]] (1940–2007), a Rugby League player *[[Berwyn Price]] (born 1951), a former Welsh international athlete '''Berwyn may also refer to:''' *[[Berwyn (CTA)]], a station on the Chicago Transit Authority's 'L' system *[[Berwyn (Metra)]], one of three stations on Metra's BNSF Railway Line, located in Berwyn, Illinois *[[Berwyn (SEPTA station)]], a commuter rail station located in the western suburbs of Philadelphia *{{USS|Berwyn|ID-3565}}, a United States Navy cargo ship in commission from 1918 to 1919 *[[Berwyn Road]] is an affluent street in the London Borough of Richmond-Upon-Thames, which marks a boundary of the London SW postal district {{disambiguation}} [[Category:Place name disambiguation pages]]
